intro: Ammi aethifolium, commonly known as sweet cicely, is a flowering plant native to Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. Its aromatic seeds are used in culinary and medicinal applications. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
